summary: Tested offline caching feature implementation. All UI elements present and functional, but core caching logic not working properly. Speed limits are fetched successfully but not cached, and cache indicators don't appear.

integration_issues.issue: Speed limits fetched but not cached - cache count remains 0
integration_issues.impact: Cache functionality not working, offline mode won't work
integration_issues.details: Demo mode fetches speed limit (25 mph) successfully, but cache count stays at 0 and cache indicators don't appear

integration_issues.issue: Cache indicator (data-testid='cache-indicator') not appearing when using cached data
integration_issues.impact: Users can't tell when cached data is being used
integration_issues.details: Both speed limit sign cache indicator and bottom status bar cache indicator not showing

passed_tests: Speed limit API with San Francisco coordinates (returns 25 mph)
Speed limit API error handling (invalid/missing params)
Speed limit API remote location handling
Settings panel opens via gear icon
OFFLINE CACHE section visible in settings
Cache stats display shows cached locations count (data-testid='cache-count')
Demo Mode indicator appears ('Demo mode active - simulating driving')
Speed limit fetched and displayed in demo mode (25 mph)
Speed limit sign appears with correct value
All existing UI elements working (regression test passed)
action_item_for_main_agent: Fix offline caching functionality: 1) Speed limits are fetched but not being cached (cache count stays 0), 2) Cache indicators not appearing when they should, 3) Verify cacheSpeedLimit() function is being called properly in SpeedMap.jsx, 4) Check localStorage storage in speedLimitCache.js utility

success_percentage.frontend_ui: 100% (All cache UI elements present and functional)
